t: Lamentations 3
I*p am the man that hath seen affliction by the rod of his wrath.
He*p hath led me, and brought me into darkness, but not into light.
Surely*p against me is he turned; he turneth his hand against me all the day.
My*p flesh and my skin hath he made old; he hath broken my bones.
He*p hath builded against me, and compassed me with gall and travail.
He*p hath set me in dark places, as they that be dead of old.
He*p hath hedged me about, that I cannot get out: he hath made my chain heavy.
Also*p when I cry and shout, he shutteth out my prayer.
He*p hath inclosed my ways with hewn stone, he hath made my paths crooked.
He*p was unto me as a bear lying in wait, and as a lion in secret places.
He*p hath turned aside my ways, and pulled me in pieces: he hath made me desolate.
He*p hath bent his bow, and set me as a mark for the arrow.
He*p hath caused the arrows of his quiver to enter into my reins.
I*p was a derision to all my people; and their song all the day.
He*p hath filled me with bitterness, he hath made me drunken with wormwood.
He*p hath also broken my teeth with gravel stones, he hath covered me with ashes.
And*p thou hast removed my soul far off from peace: I forgat prosperity.
And*p I said, My strength and my hope is perished from the Lord:*s
Remembering*p mine affliction and my misery, the wormwood and the gall.
My*p soul hath them still in remembrance, and is humbled in me.
This*p I recall to my mind, therefore have I hope.
It*p is of the Lord's*s mercies that we are not consumed, because his compassions fail not.
They*p are new every morning: great is thy faithfulness.
The*p Lord*s is my portion, saith my soul; therefore will I hope in him.
The*p Lord*s is good unto them that wait for him, to the soul that seeketh him.
It*p is good that a man should both hope and quietly wait for the salvation of the Lord.*s
It*p is good for a man that he bear the yoke in his youth.
He*p sitteth alone and keepeth silence, because he hath borne it upon him.
He*p putteth his mouth in the dust; if so be there may be hope.
He*p giveth his cheek to him that smiteth him: he is filled full with reproach.
For*p the Lord will not cast off for ever:
But*p though he cause grief, yet will he have compassion according to the multitude of his mercies.
For*p he doth not afflict willingly nor grieve the children of men.
To*p crush under his feet all the prisoners of the earth,
To*p turn aside the right of a man before the face of the most High,
To*p subvert a man in his cause, the Lord approveth not.
Who*p is he that saith, and it cometh to pass, when the Lord commandeth it not?
Out*p of the mouth of the most High proceedeth not evil and good?
Wherefore*p doth a living man complain, a man for the punishment of his sins?
Let*p us search and try our ways, and turn again to the Lord.*s
Let*p us lift up our heart with our hands unto God in the heavens.
We*p have transgressed and have rebelled: thou hast not pardoned.
Thou*p hast covered with anger, and persecuted us: thou hast slain, thou hast not pitied.
Thou*p hast covered thyself with a cloud, that our prayer should not pass through.
Thou*p hast made us as the offscouring and refuse in the midst of the people.
All*p our enemies have opened their mouths against us.
Fear*p and a snare is come upon us, desolation and destruction.
Mine*p eye runneth down with rivers of water for the destruction of the daughter of my people.
Mine*p eye trickleth down, and ceaseth not, without any intermission,
Till*p the Lord*s look down, and behold from heaven.
Mine*p eye affecteth mine heart because of all the daughters of my city.
Mine*p enemies chased me sore, like a bird, without cause.
They*p have cut off my life in the dungeon, and cast a stone upon me.
Waters*p flowed over mine head; then I said, I am cut off.
I*p called upon thy name, O Lord,*s out of the low dungeon.
Thou*p hast heard my voice: hide not thine ear at my breathing, at my cry.
Thou*p drewest near in the day that I called upon thee: thou saidst, Fear not.
O*p Lord, thou hast pleaded the causes of my soul; thou hast redeemed my life.
O*p Lord,*s thou hast seen my wrong: judge thou my cause.
Thou*p hast seen all their vengeance and all their imaginations against me.
Thou*p hast heard their reproach, O Lord,*s and all their imaginations against me;
The*p lips of those that rose up against me, and their device against me all the day.
Behold*p their sitting down, and their rising up; I am their musick.
Render*p unto them a recompence, O Lord,*s according to the work of their hands.
Give*p them sorrow of heart, thy curse unto them.
Persecute*p and destroy them in anger from under the heavens of the Lord.*s
